content:
ItemAutomationPeer Class

In this Article

Exposes a data item in an stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection to UI Automation.

Syntax

Declaration

public abstract class ItemAutomationPeer : System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer, System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • DispatcherObject
  • System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer
  • ItemAutomationPeer

Remarks

Data items that are not also UIElement types do not have children; however, they can have a UIElement tree and a corresponding UI Automation tree.

For example, a ListBox can have a collection of strings that contain data items. When those items are processed by an ItemsControl for visualization, a UIElement tree is created for them. This tree can have a corresponding UI Automation tree. After the tree is created, WPF merges the UIElement tree into a UI Automation tree. ItemAutomationPeer works with its UIElement counterpart, if it exists, to obtain more information about the UIElement tree.

Only visible data items, or more precisely, the corresponding UIElement trees, have this dualism. Non-visible data items, which have no corresponding UIElement trees, have only one ItemAutomationPeer.

Constructors summary

ItemAutomationPeer(Object,ItemsControlAutomationPeer)

Provides initialization for base class values when called by the constructor of a derived class.

Properties summary

Item

Gets the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.
ItemsControlAutomationPeer

Gets the ItemsControlAutomationPeer that is associated with the ItemsControl that holds the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection.

Methods summary

GetAcceleratorKeyCore()

Gets the accelerator key for the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.
GetAccessKeyCore()

Gets the access key for the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.
GetAutomationIdCore()

Gets the string that uniquely identifies the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.
GetBoundingRectangleCore()

Gets the Rect that represents the bounding rectangle of the specified UIElement.
GetChildrenCore()

Gets the collection of child elements of the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.
GetClickablePointCore()

Gets a Point that represents the clickable space that is on the specified UIElement.
GetHelpTextCore()

Gets the string that describes the functionality of the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.
GetItemStatusCore()

Gets a string that conveys the visual status of the specified UIElement.
GetItemTypeCore()

Gets a human-readable string that contains the type of item that the specified UIElement represents.
GetLabeledByCore()

Gets the AutomationPeer for the Label that is targeted to the specified UIElement.
GetNameCore()

Gets the text label of the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.
GetOrientationCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement is laid out in a particular direction.
GetPattern(PatternInterface)

Returns the object that supports the specified control pattern of the element that is associated with this automation peer.
HasKeyboardFocusCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement currently has keyboard input focus.
IsContentElementCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement contains data that is presented to the user.
IsControlElementCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer is understood by the end user as interactive.
IsEnabledCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement can receive and send events.
IsKeyboardFocusableCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement can accept keyboard focus.
IsOffscreenCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement is off the screen.
IsPasswordCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement contains protected content.
IsRequiredForFormCore()

Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement is required to be completed on a form.
SetFocusCore()

Sets the keyboard input focus on the specified UIElement. The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

Explicit Interface Implementations summary

IVirtualizedItemProvider.Realize()

Makes the virtual item fully accessible as a UI Automation element.

Constructors

  • ItemAutomationPeer(Object,ItemsControlAutomationPeer)

    Provides initialization for base class values when called by the constructor of a derived class.

    protected ItemAutomationPeer (object item, System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemsControlAutomationPeer itemsControlAutomationPeer);

    Parameters

    • item
      Object

      The data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

    • itemsControlAutomationPeer
      ItemsControlAutomationPeer

      The ItemsControlAutomationPeer that is associated with the ItemsControl that holds the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection.

Properties

  • Item

    Gets the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

    public object Item { get; }

    Property Value

    • Object

      The data item.

  • ItemsControlAutomationPeer

    Gets the ItemsControlAutomationPeer that is associated with the ItemsControl that holds the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection.

    public System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemsControlAutomationPeer ItemsControlAutomationPeer { get; }

    Property Value

    • ItemsControlAutomationPeer

      The ItemsControlAutomationPeer that is associated with the ItemsControl object.

Methods

  • GetAcceleratorKeyCore()

    Gets the accelerator key for the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

    protected override string GetAcceleratorKeyCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The accelerator key.

    Remarks

    This method is called by GetAcceleratorKey.

  • GetAccessKeyCore()

    Gets the access key for the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

    protected override string GetAccessKeyCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The access key.

    Remarks

    This method is called by GetAccessKey.

  • GetAutomationIdCore()

    Gets the string that uniquely identifies the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

    protected override string GetAutomationIdCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      A string that contains the UI Automation identifier.

    Remarks

    The value of the UI Automation identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property is not set, the value is the Name property.

    This method is called by GetAutomationId.

  • GetBoundingRectangleCore()

    Gets the Rect that represents the bounding rectangle of the specified UIElement.

    protected override System.Windows.Rect GetBoundingRectangleCore ();

    Returns

    • Rect

      The bounding rectangle.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by GetBoundingRectangle.

  • GetChildrenCore()

    Gets the collection of child elements of the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

    protected override System.Collections.Generic.List<System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> GetChildrenCore ();

    Returns

    • List<AutomationPeer>

      The collection of child elements.

    Remarks

    This method is called by GetChildren.

  • GetClickablePointCore()

    Gets a Point that represents the clickable space that is on the specified UIElement.

    protected override System.Windows.Point GetClickablePointCore ();

    Returns

    • Point

      The point that represents the clickable space that is on the specified UIElement.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by GetClickablePoint.

  • GetHelpTextCore()

    Gets the string that describes the functionality of the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

    protected override string GetHelpTextCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The help text.

    Remarks

    This method is called by GetHelpText.

  • GetItemStatusCore()

    Gets a string that conveys the visual status of the specified UIElement.

    protected override string GetItemStatusCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The status. Examples include "Busy" or "Online".

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by GetItemStatus.

  • GetItemTypeCore()

    Gets a human-readable string that contains the type of item that the specified UIElement represents.

    protected override string GetItemTypeCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The item type. An example includes "Mail Message" or "Contact".

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by GetItemType.

  • GetLabeledByCore()

    Gets the AutomationPeer for the Label that is targeted to the specified UIElement.

    protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer GetLabeledByCore ();

    Returns

    • System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer

      The LabelAutomationPeer for the element that is targeted by the Label.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by GetLabeledBy.

  • GetNameCore()

    Gets the text label of the UIElement that corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

    protected override string GetNameCore ();

    Returns

    • String

      The text label.

    Remarks

    You can think of the name property as if it were a string of text that users use to explain which control they are referring to. Make certain that you have a textual representation for all controls in the graphical user interface (GUI) so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.

    This method is called by GetName.

  • GetOrientationCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement is laid out in a particular direction.

    protected override System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation GetOrientationCore ();

    Returns

    • AutomationOrientation

      The direction of the specified UIElement. Optionally, the method returns AutomationOrientation if the UIElement is not laid out in a particular direction.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by GetOrientation.

  • GetPattern(PatternInterface)

    Returns the object that supports the specified control pattern of the element that is associated with this automation peer.

    public override object GetPattern (System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface patternInterface);

    Parameters

    • patternInterface
      PatternInterface

      An enumeration value that specifies the control pattern.

    Returns

    • Object

      An object that supports the control pattern if patternInterface is a supported value; otherwise, null.

    Remarks

    If patternInterface is System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface and the item is not in the visual tree, this method returns a this pointer. If patternInterface equals System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface, this method returns an object that implements the ISynchronizedInputProvider interface.

  • HasKeyboardFocusCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement currently has keyboard input focus.

    protected override bool HasKeyboardFocusCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified UIElement has keyboard input focus; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by HasKeyboardFocus.

  • IsContentElementCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement contains data that is presented to the user.

    protected override bool IsContentElementCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the element is a content element; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by IsContentElement.

  • IsControlElementCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the UIElement that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer is understood by the end user as interactive.

    protected override bool IsControlElementCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the element is a control; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection. The user might understand the UIElement as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the GUI. This method is called by IsControlElement.

  • IsEnabledCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement can receive and send events.

    protected override bool IsEnabledCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the UI Automation peer can receive and send events; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by IsEnabled.

  • IsKeyboardFocusableCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement can accept keyboard focus.

    protected override bool IsKeyboardFocusableCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the element can accept keyboard focus; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by IsKeyboardFocusable.

  • IsOffscreenCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement is off the screen.

    protected override bool IsOffscreenCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified UIElement is not on the screen; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by IsOffscreen.

    This method does not indicate whether the element is visible. In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible. For example, if the element is obscured by other elements, it might not be visible. In this case, the method returns false.

  • IsPasswordCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement contains protected content.

    protected override bool IsPasswordCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified UIElement contains protected content; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by IsPassword.

  • IsRequiredForFormCore()

    Gets a value that indicates whether the specified UIElement is required to be completed on a form.

    protected override bool IsRequiredForFormCore ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the specified UIElement is required to be completed; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the Items collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer. This method is called by IsRequiredForForm.

  • SetFocusCore()

    Sets the keyboard input focus on the specified UIElement. The UIElement corresponds to the data item in the stem.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items* collection that is associated with this ItemAutomationPeer.

    protected override void SetFocusCore ();

    Remarks

    This method is called by SetFocus.

Explicit Interface Implementations

  • IVirtualizedItemProvider.Realize()

    Makes the virtual item fully accessible as a UI Automation element.

    void IVirtualizedItemProvider.Realize ();

    Remarks

    This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the ItemAutomationPeer instance is cast to an IVirtualizedItemProvider interface.
